item.title: Genshin Impact: Hidden Chests In Ancient Sacred Mountain
item.description:
Genshin Impact surprises the community by not creating one, but two explorable new sub-areas: Atocpan and Ancient Sacred Mountain. While the latter is located beneath the volcano in Atocpan, the map is extremely large, and players are excited to explore and uncover all the hidden secrets in this area, including the long-awaited new treasure chests.

The Ancient Sacred Mountain is not related to the Archon Quest, but it has a strong connection to the little Saurian companion that Travelers encounter when they first step into Natlan. After completing various quests related to the Little One, players will be able to unlock the quest that allows them to reach the Ancient Sacred Mountain.

1 Defeat the Hidden Enemy

Go to the farthest waypoint in Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds and indwell a nearby Tatankasaurus before breaking the Pulverite to the southeast. An enemy will appear and once you defeat it, you will get a Common Chest.

2 Discover the Hidden Room

Now, teleport to the waypoint in the middle of Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds and head east towards an open area with a single glowing block on the ground. Use a Tatankasaurus' slam attack to break the block and uncover the hidden area underneath it. Continue using Tatankasaurus's sprint towards all the Pulverites at the current level to find another glowing block on the ground. Break it and enter the lowest level to find the last chunk of Pulverites. Break it and you will find a treasure chest on top of a Secret Source Dragon Idol's head.

3 Reach the Floating Island

From the previous position, activate the Dragon Idol, and it will bring you to the top of the mountain in Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds. Indwell the Qucusaur and fly to the north until you see a floating island. In this island alone, there are three treasure chests to be collected.

4 Dig the Qucusaur's Nest

Use the teleport waypoint northeast of Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds and head further north towards the edge of the island to find Qucusaur's nests. One of the nests has a 'Dig' option , and once you do so, a treasure chest will appear.

5 Break the Pulverites

  1. Go to the island in the middle of the Ancient Sacred Mountain , where it leads to the Sea of Shifting Sentience. There will be a duo of Yumkasaur, and you can indwell one of them before grabbing the nearby exploding plant. Throw it to the Pulverite to break it and get the treasure chest that spawns afterward.
  2. The second chunk of Pulverite can be found underneath the waypoint of the Ruined Armament Workshop . This time, indwell a Tatankasaurus and break the Pulverite to get the treasure chest in Genshin Impact.

6 Complete the Flowlight Targets Challenge

Next, teleport to the waypoint northeast of Sea of Shifting Sentience , and head west to the edge of the lava pool. You can find a Secret Source Servant on top of a waterwheel. In one of the slots, there is a Flowlight Target. Indwell a Koholasaurus and attack the target, causing it to break and triggering a hidden challenge. Continue breaking all the Flowlight Targets, and you will get an Exquisite Chest as a reward.

7 Destroy the Oozing Cores

  1. South of the Sea of Shifting Sentience , there are multiple smaller islands. Use a Yumkasaurus in that area to glide through the island and reach one with two Oozing Cores. Grab the exploding plant beside the cores and throw it to make the Oozing Cores disappear and get a treasure chest.
  2. The second location with Oozing Cores to be destroyed is located south of the Ruined Armament Workshop in Genshin Impact . This time, you can indwell a Tatankasaurus and sprint through the Oozing Cores to break them.

8 Break the Phlogiston on the Wall

Teleport to the Sea of Shifting Sentience southeast waypoint and head southwest to indwell a Tatankasaurus. With the Saurian, trudge to the north to find a Phlogiston rock on the wall. Use the Tatankasaurus and ram through the wall to break it and spawn an enemy. Defeat it to get a hidden treasure chest.

9 Win the Race

Go to the waypoint right below the Heart of Force Inversion , and find a Secret Source Servant in the west. Interact with the servant to start a racing tournament with other Tatankasaurus. You can indwell a Tatankasaurus or use a playable character from "Collective of Plenty" and get the first place to win a treasure chest.

10 Activate the Waterwheel Mechanism

After completing the previous race, you will be near the waterwheel located on the east . In front of the waterwheel is a Phlogiston rock that can be destroyed temporarily using Tatankasaurus. Once you destroy it, the waterwheel will spin and reveal the hidden chest . Remember that it will only spin once and stop afterward. But don't worry, because the Phlogiston rock will reappear again, so you can keep trying until you get the treasure chest.

11 Dig the Cracked Ground

South of the Heart of Force Inversion , you can find a single Furnace Shell Mountain Weasel near a cracked ground. Defeat it, and afterward, there will be a 'Dig' option on the ground. Tap on it to spawn a treasure chest.

12 Complete the Lava Puzzle

On the edge of the lava pool of the Ruined Armament Workshop , there is a single box near the ground. Stand on top of the box once, and a puzzle will start where you need to step onto the upcoming boxes that have no bombs until you reach the Exquisite Chest in the middle.

13 Follow Along the Secret Source Dragon Idol

Teleport to the Ruined Armament Workshop southeast waypoint and head north to the edge of the mountain. Wait until a flying Secret Source Dragon Idol comes near and jump on top of it. On top of the idol, there is a switch that you can pull to unlock a nearby Exquisite Chest. After getting it, continue standing on top of the dragon and pull the switch once again to make it move and bring you to another location and spawn a hidden chest.

14 Complete the Hidden Time-Trial Challenge

Use the waypoint north of Esoteric Arrays and head east to find a small mechanism in front of boxes. Once you activate the mechanism, a time-trial challenge where you need to collect Pyro Particles within the time limit.

15 Break the Shining Boxes

Go to the waypoint south of Pseudostar Pedestal and head to the upper level before indwelling a Tatankasaurus and move a platform to the right. Behind the platform is a hidden room with multiple boxes. There are three treasure chests underneath some of the boxes, so you can break them to get all the chests.

16 Find the Iridescent Legacy

  1. The first one can be found southeast of the Sea of Shifting Sentience . Once you reach the location, indwell a nearby Yumkasaur and throw the exploding fruits on the Oozing Cores . Once you destroy all the Abyssal leftovers, you will get a Precious Chest.
  2. The second part is located on the lower level of Flame-Melding Ritual Grounds . Teleport to the farthest waypoint on this floating island, and drop down gliding to the lower level. Walk to the middle area where you can find Pulverites with a mark on the front. Break the Pulverites and defeat the enemy underneath it to get a Precious Chest.
  3. On the edge of the lava pool in Heart of Force Inversion , there are two Oozing Cores that need to be destroyed. Indwell a Tatankasaurus and sprint towards the Oozing Cores to break them and spawn a Precious Chest.
6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Last Epoch: How to Get & Use Runes
item.description:
Runes are consumable materials that players can use to directly change craftable gear in Last Epoch . Instead of simply modifying outcomes like Glyphs or adding new affixes like Shards, these affect your items in more significant ways.

As with all the other things related to Last Epoch's crafting system, players will need to do a fair bit of farming if they want to stock up on Runes. If you plan on sitting down for a big crafting session to make your builds work, here's a guide on how to get Runes, including an overview of what each of them does.

How to Farm Runes in Last Epoch

Runes drop randomly from almost every loot source in the game, though they tend to drop more frequently from the following:

  • Bosses
  • Chests/Caches
  • Elites
  • Champions
  • Loot Lizards
  • Nemeses

If you joined the Circle of Fortune, you can find and complete Prophecies that reward Runes.

As you play through the campaign, you'll find a decent number of Runes throughout your romp through time. However, if you want to target-farm Runes, you can do so by entering the Monolith of Fates and searching for Echoes with Rune rewards .

Monoliths each contain a vast web of Echoes (maps) with guaranteed rewards. Not only that, but maps also have a good chance of containing tons of elites, champions, and Nemesis spawn points. Defeat as many of these enemies as you fly through a map, and you should get a few Runes for your trouble.

Last Epoch: All Runes (& What They Do)

As mentioned earlier, Runes can affect item crafting in serious ways. This isn't necessarily a good thing, however, as most Runes can either upgrade or ruin your items if you're unlucky. Here's what these Runes can do:

Rune

Effect

Rune of Shattering

Gain a random number of Affix Shards based on what an item has. Destroys the item in the process.

Rune of Removal

Removes a random affix from an item. You receive an equal amount of Shards for that removed Affix.

Rune of Refinement

Rerolls all affixes on your item. Keep in mind that affix stat ranges are determined by their tier.

Rune of Discovery

Adds random tier 1 affixes to all empty affix slots, with a higher chance of rolling a rare affix. This does not cost Forging Potential, but it cannot be used on items with no Forging Potential.

Rune of Shaping

Rerolls the implicit stats on an item.

Rune of Ascendance

Completely transforms an item into a Unique or Set Item of the same type. This Rune cannot transform items into Uniques or Set Items that are exclusive, like the ones that drop only from bosses.

Rune of Creation

Create another copy of an item. Forging Potential of both the original and duplicate items are set to zero.

Rune of Havoc

Shuffles the tiers of non-sealed affixes on an Exalted item that has at least four affixes. This does not increase or decrease the tiers of affixes.

Rune of Redemption

Changes the Exalted affix on an item to a random one. This does not affect the tier of the affix.

Rune of Weaving

Uses the remaining amount of Weaver's Will or Weaver's Touch on an item to upgrade the item's affixes.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - 8 Best Early Skills
item.description:
Summary

  • Characters in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 have skill trees with unique abilities to unlock.
  • Skill Points unlock spells like earth-based attacks or healing, while Attribute Points boost stats.
  • Strategic choices like Guard Down or Rebirth can be crucial, offering offensive or healing advantages in battles.

Every character in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has a skill tree. When a character levels up, they will gain one Skill Point and three Attribute Points. Skill Points are not shared and can unlock spells or abilities to use in battle, from sword attacks to fire maelstroms.

Attribute Points can boost stats, such as health, once locked into the correct category. With so many skills to choose from upon leveling up in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , it can be hard to know what to pick, even with the ability to respec. Players will start early with Gustave, Lune, and Maelle, so let's focus this List on their skill trees, and the best early-game skills to unlock for them in Clair Obscure: Expedition 33. .

8 Earth Rising

Earth Magic Targets All Enemies

  • Character : Lune

Earth Rising is one of the quickest ways to get a skill to target all enemies in battle. Lune can raise up the earth, Avatar Earthbender-style, and savage enemies from the ground.

While Earth Rising is not too powerful, it is always useful to hit multiple enemies in an RPG to make battles end quicker. More powerful spells that Lune can learn and which can hit every enemy in battle include Wildfire, which is fire-based, and Thunderfall, which is lightning-based.

7 Fleuret Fury

Hit A Target Three Times With Maelles Sword

  • Character : Maelle

Fleuret Fury is for Maelle. It's a sword-based attack that can hit an enemy three times with powerful strikes. The damage is good, but the number of hits is better. Enemies can create Shields, and every Shield that they erect requires a single attack to take it out. For example, if an enemy has three Shields up, then just a simple attack from a character wont do any damage, but will destroy the Shield instead.

However, Fleuret Fury and other skills like it can break through Shields in a single turn, or at least thats the hope when players are trying to devise strategies in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . This makes it very useful to have in the early game.

6 Guard Down

Lower The Defense Of All Enemies

  • Character : Maelle

This next skill, which also belongs to Maelle, is called Guard Down . It will lower the defense of the enemy party. Its the same as saying that players can do more damage during this skills duration, but its all the same thing in an RPG, even if the name or exact definitions are different.

During normal battles, Guard Down probably wont be necessary, but main boss fights or optional bosses definitely require some debuffs. Maelle can also learn Guard Up, which will raise the partys defenses and also good for boss encounters.

5 Healing Light

Heal An Allys HP

  • Character : Lune

There are limited ways to heal in the game, so every resource is precious. Thats because players cannot directly buy things like healing potions, as flasks can be upgraded and recharged instead in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, similar to games like Dark Souls .

There are two early single-target healing spells, though, which can be used in battle. Lune can learn Healing Light, and Gustave can learn Recovery, and they are both worth getting as soon as possible to improve the party's survivability.

4 Mayhem

Convert Stains Into A Strong Attack

  • Character : Lune

Every character is different in terms of how their actions and skills work. For example, Lune could be categorized as a Mage in an RPG as she slings elemental spells at enemies.

After using a certain spell, like one involving fire or ice, a Stain will accumulate, and Mayhem is a non-elemental spell that will drain all built-up Stains to strike one enemy with a powerful attack. Until players learn Mayhem for Lune, Stains are kind of useless beyond spell costs, so be sure to go down that rabbit hole and get it quickly.

3 Powerful

Raise The Partys Attack Power

  • Character : Gustave

Powerful is a simple support skill for Gustave that will raise the partys attack power for a limited time. If players combine Maelles Guard Down skill with Powerful, then they can do some serious damage to enemies.

Its not the most exciting skill Gustave has to offer, but support skills rarely are. Support skills like Powerful are for players who like to use more strategy in their turn-based RPGs instead of always just mashing buttons. Once again, when it comes to boss battles, Powerful will be very valuable.

2 Rebirth

Revive A Fallen Ally

  • Character : Lune

Rebirth is another great healing spell for Lune, as it can revive a fallen ally. Again, there are limited ways to heal allies, and even fewer ways to revive characters in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, so Rebirth is a god-tier early skill.

It will help when a particularly challenging optional boss has players downed. They can often one-shot party members, no matter how much grinding players do. Of course, Rebirth doesnt help if Lune falls, but hopefully, players are thoughtful enough to boost her Defense Attribute more than others in order to keep her alive, so that she can do the same for the rest of the party.

1 Shatter

Strike All Enemies With Lightning

  • Character : Gustave

Shatter is a very strong offensive skill for Gustave. Its lightning-based and can target all enemies on screen, with the highlighted monster attracting the most damage. To use it, players have to build up Gustaves unique Overcharge meter, but using Shatter will not dispel it, unlike other attacks.

Unlocking Shatter will be quicker than unlocking Thunderfall for Lune, and it should be noted that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33s Flying Waters area has a lot of monsters that are weak to lightning-based attacks roaming around in it, which makes this a particularly valuable skill for completing that region.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: Dead Rails: Class Tier List
item.description:
To survive in Dead Rails , players need to work in a team. To make it more interesting for you to form a party, the developers added a Class system to the game. Therefore, in this guide, you will find a detailed Dead Rails Class tier list , in which we have ranked all the Classes from the best to the weakest.

Unlocking Classes is quite expensive in this Roblox survival horror, but they can significantly simplify your survival by adding various passive bonuses to stats. Moreover, your starting inventory also receives bonus items.

Updated on April 25, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: In this Tier List, you will find the current ranking of all Dead Rails classes. We have added all new classes, up to v1.0.0-alpha.578. And of course, the balance of power has changed a little, so some classes are now in higher tiers.

How to Unlock Classes in Dead Rails

New players in Dead Rails always start with the None Class, or in other words, no Class at all. You do not get any abilities or modifiers. Moreover, you will only have a Shovel in your inventory. Of course, this is a good challenge for your skills, but by changing Classes, you can get a completely new experience in Dead Rails , and for this, you need to visit the Tailor.

His Shop is easy to spot in the lobby town because of the huge sign. Players just need to go inside and talk to the NPC to go to the Class selection menu. At the time of writing, there are 16 Classes in Dead Rails , each of which costs a different amount of Bonds.

All Classes in Dead Rails offer various bonuses and starting equipment, but the Doctor deserves special attention, as he can be both one of the best Classes and quite mediocre, depending on who is playing him. Thanks to the ability to heal other players without spending items, as well as having medicine items from the start, he is the best choice for playing in a team. However, you should change to another Class for solo runs.

To make it easier for you to choose which Class to spend Bonds on first, we have ranked all Dead Rails Classes from best to worst in our tier list.

Dead Rails Class Tier List

Class

Tier

Bonuses

Cost

Doctor

S Tier

You can heal teammates using half of your health without using a bandage. 1 Shovel 2 Snake Oil 2 Bandage

15 Bonds

The Alamo

S Tier

Spawn with defensive items. 1 Helmet 1 Shovel 3 Barbed Wire 3 Metal Sheet

50 Bonds

Werewolf

S Tier

During the night, your health, speed, and damage are doubled. But starting on the second day, your health, speed, and damage during the day are reduced by 10%. 1 Shovel

50 Bonds

Vampire

S Tier

Your movement speed and melee damage are doubled, but you take damage from direct sunlight. 1 Shovel and 1 Vampire Knife

75 Bonds

Cowboy

S Tier

1 Revolver, 2 Revolver Ammo packs, 1 Shovel, 1 Horse, and Saddle

50 Bonds

Arsonist

A Tier

You deal double Fire damage. 1 Shovel 4 Molotov

20 Bonds

Ironclad

A Tier

Your movement speed is reduced by 20%. 1 Chestplate 1 Helmet 1 Right Shoulder Armor 1 Left Shoulder Armor 1 Shovel

100 Bonds

Miner

A Tier

1 Mining Helmet, 1 Pickaxe, 1 Shovel, and 2 Coal

15 Bonds

Survivalist

A Tier

Your ranged weapon damage is doubled. You also gain +1% to all melee and ranged damage for every 1 HP lost. 1 Tomahawk and 1 Shovel

75 Bonds

High Roller

B Tier

Each Money Bag gives you 1.5x more money, but you are 10x more likely to be struck by lightning than other classes. 1 Shovel

50 Bonds

Packmaster

B Tier

Each wolf that bites you once is automatically tamed. 3 Wolves and 1 Shovel

35 Bonds

Musician

B Tier

Playing the banjo will slowly restore health to nearby players, but not to yourself. 1 Banjo

15 Bonds

Priest

B Tier

You are immune to lightning strikes. 1 Shovel, 2 Holy Water, and 2 Crucifix

75 Bonds

Zombie

B Tier

You can eat corpses to restore health, and you are also less noticeable by enemies. But you cannot use Bandages or Snake Oil to heal. Shovel

75 Bonds

Necromancer

C Tier

Killing an enemy with a melee weapon has a 25% chance of reincarnating them as a servant, but this will cost you 10 HP. Shovel

35 Bonds

Conductor

C Tier

While you are driving the Train, its max speed is 30% higher. 2 Coal

50 Bonds

*Doctor becomes a C Tier Class when doing solo runs in Dead Rails.

item.title: Lords of the Fallen: How To Get Pieta's Sword
item.description:
Lords of the Fallen throws players into brutal combat right from the start, making early boss fights especially tough as you adjust to the game's mechanics. One of the first major challenges is Pieta, a Radiance-based boss known for her wide-reaching attacks and fast combos. For Pietas Sword, players must follow a few steps, including defeating her. This guide explains how to obtain it in Lords of the Fallen .

Players should always carry Vestige Seeds to create temporary resting spots at Vestige beds. This also allows them to have a checkpoint closer to boss locations.

How To Get Pieta's Sword In Lords of the Fallen

To acquire Pieta's Sword , players must make their way to the Skyrest Bridge , where they will fight Pieta, She of Blessed Renewal . She is the first main boss in the game, excluding the Lightreaper tutorial fight in the beginning. Players can reach her by making their way forward from the Redcopse Windmill Vestige. The boss fight is quite challenging, especially because of the clones she summons to aid her during battle.

Defeating her rewards the player with some Umbral Scouring and the Remembrance of Pieta, She of Blessed Renewal , which you are going to need. With the boss defeated and the Skyrest Bridge Vestige activated, you must now travel to the Pilgrim's Perch location to retrieve the Bowl of Revelations .

Where to Find the Bowl of Revelations

From the Vestige of Blind Agatha , head through the tunnel on the right and hug the left wall until you go through the crack in the wooden wall. Take a right and jump onto the moving wooden platform, then jump to the ramp on the side . Go all the way to the end, and you will come upon a ladder that you must climb down. Ignore the enemies along the way, as they won't follow you down.

Once you climb down the ladder, you will spot another ladder, but before climbing down this one, change into the Umbral Realm to make sure there is a floor below. Head down and you will spot an Umbral Belly that you can Soulflay to get the Bowl of Revelations.

Giving the Bowl of Revelations to Molhu

With the Bowl of Revelations in your possession, head back to the Skyrest Bridge and enter the Umbral Realm . Head up to Molhu, and you will have the option to hand over the Bowl of Revelations. Doing so adds a new option of offering Remembrances . Select Pieta, and you will have the option to purchase her armor, Blessed Reflections (Radiance Spell), and Pieta's Sword. The boss weapon costs 40 Umbral Scouring .
